com.gl.vn.me.ko.pies.base.feijoa

Class ExecutorUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gl.vn.me.ko.pies.base.feijoa.ExecutorUtil

  • public final class ExecutorUtil
extends Object
    This class provides various utility methods related to Executors.

    • Method Detail

      • shutdownGracefully

        public static final List<Runnable> shutdownGracefully(ExecutorService executorService,
                                                      long quietTime,
                                                      long timeout,
                                                      TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Performs a graceful shutdown of the supplied executorService.
        Parameters:
        executorService - An ExecutorService to shutdown.
        quietTime - During this amount of time executorService will continue to execute previously submitted tasks but no new tasks will be accepted (see ExecutorService.shutdown()). If quietTime has elapsed and executorService isn't terminated then ExecutorService.shutdownNow() is invoked followed by the awaitTermination(timeout - quietTime, timeUnit) method.

        This argument MUST NOT be greater than timeout.

        timeout - The total amount of time this method is allowed to spend till return.
        timeUnit - The time unit of the time arguments.
        Returns:
        List of tasks that never commenced execution (see ExecutorService.shutdownNow()).

      • shutdownGracefully

        public static final List<Runnable> shutdownGracefully(ExecutorService executorService)
        Shortcut method for shutdownGracefully(ExecutorService, long, long, TimeUnit) with sensible default values.
        Parameters:
        executorService - An ExecutorService to shutdown.
        Returns:
        List of tasks that never commenced execution (see ExecutorService.shutdownNow()).

      • unshutdownable

        public static final ExecutorService unshutdownable(ExecutorService executorService)
        Returns an unshutdownable view of the specified executorService. Unshutdownable means that methods ExecutorService.shutdown() and ExecutorService.shutdownNow() always throw an unchecked Exception.
        Parameters:
        executorService - An ExecutorService for which an unshutdownable view is to be returned.
        Returns:
        An unshutdownable view of the specified executorService.
